Dan Gorman
July 1 at 3:38 PM ·

I want to congratulate Cindy Basset on her retirement as Montague High School's Head Cook. Cindy had been with the district for 20 years and I will run out of adjective to describe what a wonderful employee and person. Cindy is hard working, funny, kind, smart, easy going, creative, caring, supportive, flexible, dedicated, friendly, gets along with everyone, and funny. I know I said funny twice but I would laugh everyday with Cindy and she was famous for her joke of the day with all the high school students. I am truly grateful for our time together, Cindy is a great employee but a better person and I have been made a better person having work with her.

shared_text:

September 2019 ·

Recently we celebrated our annual RRO Elementary Harvest Day event! Montague School Food Service invited families to join their students for a festive fall harvest lunch featuring local Michigan vegetables and fruits serving over 600 students and family members. Our always hard working Food Service staff, assisted by #MHSFFA students, made sure everyone enjoyed a delicious meal of turkey pot roast stew with just picked Michigan potatoes, carrots, onions, a dinner roll, Michigan watermelon, salad bar, and of course a big scoop of Country Dairy ice cream. A Michigan-made meal worth celebrating!
